dialogueTree.title: Door, Apartment #20: "A weathered brown door. The number..."
dialogueTree.text: A weathered brown door. The number reads '20'.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Something smells good -- soupe à l'..."
links.text: Something smells good -- soupe à l'oignon?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant motions you to go ah..."
links.text: The lieutenant motions you to go ahead and knock.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is the door, you already know..."
links.text: This is the door, you already know it's the right door. This is going to be *so hard*.

links.title: Volition: "Get yourself together. It's just po..."
links.text: Get yourself together. It's just police work.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Don't knock, just leave. You don't..."
links.text: Don't knock, just leave. You don't need this. You don't need to *sad it up*.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, Kim, we should discuss th..."
links.text: "Hold on, Kim, we should discuss this before we move on. What should we expect?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, let's talk this thro..."
links.text: "You're right, let's talk this through." He looks at the apartment door and lowers his voice a bit...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear some light footsteps and w..."
links.text: You hear some light footsteps and what appears to be a daily weather forecast playing on the radio.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We have our first preliminary iden..."
links.text: "We have our first preliminary identification -- in all likelihood the deceased is the husband of Billie Méjean. We need to confirm this, as well as deliver the death notification to Billie herself."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, delivering a death notificati..."
links.text: "Now, delivering a death notification is never an easy task. There's a reason why it's often called the most stressful part of our job. This is why it's usually done in pairs. You got this. I'll be monitoring reactions, ready to act if necessary."

links.title: You: ""Do you have any advice on how to t..."
links.text: "Do you have any advice on how to tell her he's...?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Dead? Just don't say that you know..."
links.text: "Dead? Just don't say that you know how they feel. You don't."

links.title: Empathy: "Good advice."
links.text: Good advice.

links.title: You: ""What if I don't want to do this?""
links.text: "What if I don't want to do this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, it's hard." He stares at the..."
links.text: "Yes, it's hard." He stares at the front door for a moment, his face still. "But there is no easy way to handle this information. It just has to happen, as soon as possible."

links.title: You: ""Kim, I don't want to do this, let'..."
links.text: "Kim, I don't want to do this, let's turn around." (Try to bail out.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We can't. Someone has to deliver t..."
links.text: "We can't. Someone has to deliver the news." He motions towards the door. "Let's go."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "This only made it harder. Here come..."
links.text: This only made it harder. Here comes the pain.

links.title: You: ""Alright, I think I'm ready." (Proc..."
links.text: "Alright, I think I'm ready." (Proceed.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant motions towards the..."
links.text: The lieutenant motions towards the door.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Chances are that whoever's going t..."
links.text: "Chances are that whoever's going to greet us behind that door is somehow related to the deceased. This means that our job here is to deliver the death notification, as well as identify the body."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear some light footsteps and w..."
links.text: You hear some light footsteps and what appears to be a late-night talk show playing on the radio.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear light footsteps passing by..."
links.text: You hear light footsteps passing by the door and some folk music playing on the radio.

links.title: You: "Knock."
links.text: Knock.

links.title: Door, Apartment #20: "No one answers the door."
links.text: No one answers the door.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's too late, I think everyone's..."
links.text: "It's too late, I think everyone's already asleep. We should try again tomorrow."

links.title: Door, Apartment #20: "No one answers the door. They must..."
links.text: No one answers the door. They must be sleeping at this hour. Better try again tomorrow.

links.title: Door, Apartment #20: ""Hello! Who is it?" A voice calls o..."
links.text: "Hello! Who is it?" A voice calls out from the other side of the door.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "And someone turns down the radio."
links.text: And someone turns down the radio.

links.title: You: "Look at the lieutenant first."
links.text: Look at the lieutenant first.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He gives you a short encouraging no..."
links.text: He gives you a short encouraging nod.

links.title: You: ""Is this Billie Méjean's home? This..."
links.text: "Is this Billie Méjean's home? This is the police, please open the door."

links.title: Door, Apartment #20: ""The police? A moment, please, give..."
links.text: "The police? A moment, please, give us a moment." You hear shuffling inside.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Tidying up. Nervously."
links.text: Tidying up. Nervously.

links.title: Empathy: "There's fear in her voice."
links.text: There's fear in her voice.

links.title: Door, Apartment #20: "She unlocks the door. "Come in, the..."
links.text: She unlocks the door. "Come in, the door is open."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
